issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

components.name: Studio
components.description: Please enter tickets related to Titanium Studio here.

fields.description:
When attempting to start a debugging build in the Studio the application hangs on both iOS and Android.
 
iOS behavior: Hangs specifically during the "The debugger is waiting for you to launch the "<appname>" app on your device". Doesn't respond even when the app is launched. I can see console output from the phone but nothing from the debug view in Studio.

Android behavior: Gets to the point where the debugger dialog window disappears and is supposed to start the app automatically, but it never does and the app can't even be launched manually. It just hangs at the splash screen. Can see in the progress tab that the main process "Initializing debugger" is running and some other process keeps restarting over and over.
fields.summary: Debugger hangs when waiting for application to launch. Does not respond to app launch.
fields.environment:
Mac Mini (late 2012) running macOS Sierra version 10.12.6
iOS devices:
- iPod Touch 5th Gen
- iPad Pro 9.7
Android device: Google Nexus 5X

Running:
Studio version  4.9.1.201707200100-20072017010049
Ti SDK 6.1.2.GA

comments.body: Hello, Can you try on the latest SDK 6.2.2.GA and studio 4.10 ? Thanks.
Hello [~zlitten], Are you still having the issue? Can you try SDK 6.3.0.GA?
